intro: Erinus portulacaster, commonly known as the silverleaf eryngo, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features silver-gray foliage with a fuzzy texture, which helps it retain moisture in arid conditions. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Erinus portulacaster is often used in rock gardens and as a ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and attractive appearance.
